The principle of liberty, of privacy, of the pursuit of happiness, unencumbered by the chains of fear.

And so, we are left with a paradox. A paradox of safety and freedom, of security and liberty. And it is in this paradox that we find our truth. That the justification for our actions, for the monitoring of individuals without probable cause, is not in the act itself, but in the reasons we do it. Not in the means, but in the end. And if that end is the preservation of our humanity, our freedom, then perhaps, just perhaps, we may find our way through the darkness, into the light.
